question: How does the final work?
answer: The final is only worth 5% of the grade, BUT if you get a 60% or higher, you get the “+” grade of the grade you finished at prior to the final. But if you fail the final (eg. 59% or lower), you get the “-” grade of the LETTER BELOW you finished at. So for example, let’s say you get a B in the course prior to the final. If you pass it, you get a B+. If you fail it, you get a C-.
